result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin S Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 113 Days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Case 14CF1007.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Case 14CF1007 and 15CF363.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge and sample are waived.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Defendant to remain at the transitional living center as long as deemed appropriate.
No contact with any victim/businesses/co-actors listed in the criminal complaint or read in lists.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact Probation by 09:00 a.m. on 03-30-2016.

records.addlTxt: Letter from court to defendant denying his request to reinstate huber; Judge Dreyfus will not intervene.

It is ordered that the defendant's huber privileges are hereby revoked until the defendant's behavior is deemed appropriate for confinement at the Huber Facility.

Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-02-2016)
Prior: 4020 W. Burleigh St, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States
Response letter from court denying defendant's request for sentence credit or any modification of sentence.

Filed by the Defendant, requesting the court order the credit time stayed if he is revoked be applied to his condition time.

6/2/16 - Court denied defendant's request.
Approved and signed by the Court:  Defendant to serve 125 days Huber with all standard release conditions as condition time in the Waukesha County Jail for said Defendant's non-compliance.
Letter dated May 3, 2016, filed by Department of Corrections, requesting condition time be imposed with proposed order for commitment for condition time for non-compliance with probation conditions.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kevin S Stewart in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2.5 Years.
113 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
Concurrent to:  case 14CF1007
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent to:  case 14CF1007 & 15CF363
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant to remain at the transitional living center as long as deemed appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any victim/businesses/co-actors listed in the compliant or read in lists.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant to contact probation by 9 am. tomorrow (03/30/16).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
